Team4450.Lib

Class SynchronousPID

  • java.lang.Object
    • Team4450.Lib.SynchronousPID

  • public class SynchronousPID
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a PID Control Loop. Does all computation synchronously (i.e. the calculate() function must be called by the user from his own thread) This class courtesy of Team 254.

    • Constructor Summary

        Ki - the integral coefficient

        Parameters:
        Kp - the proportional coefficient
        Ki - the integral coefficient
        Kd - the derivative coefficient
        Kf - the feed forward gain coefficient

    • Method Detail

      • calculate

        public double calculate(double input,
                        double dt)
        Read the input, calculate the output accordingly, and write to the output. This should be called at a constant rate by the user (ex. in a timed thread)
        Parameters:
        input - the input
        dt - time passed since previous call to calculate
        Returns:
        the output

      • setPID

        public void setPID(double p,
                   double i,
                   double d)
        Set the PID controller gain parameters. Set the proportional, integral, and differential coefficients.
        Parameters:
        p - Proportional coefficient
        i - Integral coefficient
        d - Differential coefficient

      • setPID

                   double d,
                   double f)
        Set the PID controller gain parameters. Set the proportional, integral, and differential coefficients.
        Parameters:
        p - Proportional coefficient
        i - Integral coefficient
        d - Differential coefficient
        f - Feed forward coefficient

        public double get()
        Return the current PID result This is always centered on zero and constrained the the max and min outs
        Returns:
        the latest calculated output

      • setContinuous

        public void setContinuous(boolean continuous)
        Set the PID controller to consider the input to be continuous, Rather then using the max and min in as constraints, it considers them to be the same point and automatically calculates the shortest route to the setpoint.
        Parameters:
        continuous - Set to true turns on continuous, false turns off continuous

      • setDeadband

        public void setDeadband(double deadband)

      • setContinuous

        public void setContinuous()
        Set the PID controller to consider the input to be continuous, Rather then using the max and min in as constraints, it considers them to be the same point and automatically calculates the shortest route to the setpoint.

        public void setInputRange(double minimumInput,
                          double maximumInput)

        Parameters:
        minimumInput - the minimum value expected from the input
        maximumInput - the maximum value expected from the output
